summary: EBV is a very common virus that can cause several diseases. It's known to cause "mono" or infectious mononucleosis, which makes people feel tired, have a fever, and sore throat. This virus can also lead to some types of cancer, like Burkitt lymphoma and Hodgkin's lymphoma. EBV is found in saliva and genital fluids, and most people get infected at some point in their lives, usually as kids or adults. Many don't show any symptoms, but it can be serious in some cases. There's no approved vaccine yet to prevent EBV infection.
